sen.j: 高鴨神社（たかかもじんじゃ）は、奈良県御所市の金剛山 (金剛山地)東山麓にある神社。
sen.e: Takakamo-jinja Shrine is located at the eastern foot of Mt. Kongo (The Kongo Mountains) at Gose City in Nara Prefecture.
Takakamo-jinja Shrine is located at the eastern foot of Mount Kongo, in the Kongo Mountains, at Gose City in Nara Prefecture.
Takakamo-jinja Shrine is located at the eastern foot of Mount Kongo, in the Kongo Mountains, at Gose City in Nara Prefecture.
Shikinaisha (Myojin Taisha) Shrine listed in the Engishiki
It is a shikinaisha (Myojin Taisha) shrine and is listed in the Engishiki.
sen.cmt: Made into a sentence. 'Engishiki' and 'shikinaisha' need an explanation in English.
sen.e: It is a shikinaisha (Myojin Taisha) shrine and is listed in the Engishiki.

sen.j: 京都の賀茂神社（賀茂別雷神社・賀茂御祖神社）を始めとする全国のカモ（鴨・賀茂・加茂）神社の総本社と称する。
sen.e: The shrine is said to be the head shrine of all Kamo-jinja shines across the nation including Kamo Wakeikazuchi-jinja and Kamo Mioya-jinja shrines in Kyoto.
The shrine is the head shrine of all Kamo-jinja shrines across Japan including the Kamo Wakeikazuchi-jinja and Kamo Mioya-jinja shrines in Kyoto.
The shrine is the head shrine of all Kamo-jinja shrines across Japan including the Kamo Wakeikazuchi-jinja and Kamo Mioya-jinja shrines in Kyoto.

sen.j: 4月中旬から5月初旬にかけて500種2200鉢以上のサクラソウが咲く。
sen.e: More than 500 species of Japanese woodland primrose bloom in more than 2200 pots from the middle of April to the beginning of May.
More than 500 species of Japanese woodland primrose bloom here in over 2200 pots from the middle of April to the beginning of May.
More than 500 species of Japanese woodland primrose bloom here in over 2200 pots from the middle of April to the beginning of May.

sen.j: アヂスキタカヒコネ（迦毛之大御神）を主祭神とし、シタテルヒメ・アメノワカヒコを配祀する。
sen.e: The main deity is Ajisukitakahikone-no-Mikoto (Kamo-no-Omikami) and other associated deities are Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto and Amenowakahiko-no-Mikoto.
The main deity is Ajisukitakahikone-no-Mikoto (Kamo-no-Omikami) and other associated deities are Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto and Amenowakahiko-no-Mikoto.
The main deity is Ajisukitakahikone-no-Mikoto (Kamo-no-Omikami) and other associated deities are Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto and Amenowakahiko-no-Mikoto.

sen.j: 古くは阿治須岐高日子根命と下照比売命の二柱を祀っていたものが、後に日本神話の影響を受けて、下照比売命の夫とされた天稚彦命、母とされた多紀理毘売命が加えられたものとみられている。
sen.e: In ancient times, two deities, Ajisukitakahikone-no-Mikoto and Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto were enshrined and laterAmenowakahiko－no-Mikoto who was the husband of Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto and Tagirihime-no-Mikoto who was Mother of Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto were said to have been added according to Japanese mythology.

In ancient times, only two deities, Ajisukitakahikone-no-Mikoto and Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto, were enshrined, but later Amenowakahiko-no-Mikoto (the husband of Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto) and Tagirihime-no-Mikoto (the mother of Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto) were added to reflect elements of Japanese mythology.

In ancient times, only two deities, Ajisukitakahikone-no-Mikoto and Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto, were enshrined, but later Amenowakahiko-no-Mikoto (the husband of Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto) and Tagirihime-no-Mikoto (the mother of Shitateruhime-no-Mikoto) were added to reflect elements of Japanese mythology.

sen.j: ただし、主祭神以外の祭神については異説が多い。
sen.e: However, there are a wide variety of different theories concerning the deities apart from the main deity.
However, there is a wide variety of different theories concerning the secondary deities.
However, there is a wide variety of different theories concerning the secondary deities.

sen.j: 現在高鴨神社社務所では、上記の神の他に事代主・阿治須岐速雄命を配祀するとしている。
sen.e: At present, the Takakamo-jinja Shrine's officials say that the shrine also enshrines Kotoshironushi-no-Mikoto and Ajisukihayao-no-Mikoto in addition to the deities mentioned above.
Officials at Takakamo-jinja Shrine state that in addition to the deities mentioned above it also enshrines Kotoshironushi-no-Mikoto and Ajisukihayao-no-Mikoto.
Officials at Takakamo-jinja Shrine state that in addition to the deities mentioned above it also enshrines Kotoshironushi-no-Mikoto and Ajisukihayao-no-Mikoto.

sen.j: 『特選神名牒』では阿治須岐高彦根命と多紀理比売命としている。
sen.e: In the "Tokusen-Shinmyocho (annotated edition of Engishiki Shrine Name Book)", Ajisukitakahiko-no-Mikoto and Tagirihime-no-Mikoto were listed.
Ajisukitakahiko-no-Mikoto and Tagirihime-no-Mikoto are listed in the "Tokusen-Shinmyocho" annotated edition of the Engishiki Shrine Name Book.
Ajisukitakahiko-no-Mikoto and Tagirihime-no-Mikoto are listed in the "Tokusen-Shinmyocho" annotated edition of the Engishiki Shrine Name Book.

sen.j: 「主祭神以外の神は不詳」とする説もある。
sen.e: Another theory holds that deities other than the main deity are unidentified.
Another theory holds that other unidentified deities are also enshrined.
Another theory holds that other unidentified deities are also enshrined.

sen.j: 当地は鴨氏一族の発祥の地であり、その氏神として祀られたものである。
sen.e: The precincts of the shrine were the birthplace of the Kamo clan and their guardian deity was enshrined here.
In addition, the Kamo clan originated from the immediate area of the shrine and their guardian deity is enshrined here.
In addition, the Kamo clan originated from the immediate area of the shrine and their guardian deity is enshrined here.

sen.j: 鴨氏はこの丘陵から奈良盆地に出て、葛城川の岸辺に移った一族が鴨都波神社を、東持田に移った一族が葛木御歳神社を祀った。
sen.e: Among the ancestors of the Kamo clan, who moved out of the hilly land to the Nara basin, one family settled along the Katsuragi River erecting Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine and another settled at Higashimochida erecting Katsuragi Mitoshi jinja-Shrine.

Among the ancestors of the Kamo clan, who moved out of the hilly land for the Nara basin, one branch of the family settled along the Katsuragi River erecting Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine, and another settled at Higashimochida and erected Katsuragi Mitoshi jinja-Shrine.

Among the ancestors of the Kamo clan, who moved out of the hilly land for the Nara basin, one branch of the family settled along the Katsuragi River erecting Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine, and another settled at Higashimochida and erected Katsuragi Mitoshi jinja-Shrine.

sen.j: 後に、高鴨神社を上鴨社、御歳神社を中鴨社、鴨都波神社を下鴨社と呼ぶようになった。
sen.e: Later Takakamo-jinja Shrine was renamed Kamikamosha Shrine, Katsuragi Mitoshi-jinja Shrine as Nakakamosha Shrine and Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine as Shimokamosha Shrine.
Later Takakamo-jinja Shrine was renamed Kamikamosha Shrine, Katsuragi Mitoshi-jinja Shrine as Nakakamosha Shrine and Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine as Shimokamosha Shrine.
Later Takakamo-jinja Shrine was renamed Kamikamosha Shrine, Katsuragi Mitoshi-jinja Shrine as Nakakamosha Shrine and Kamotsuba-jinja Shrine as Shimokamosha Shrine.

sen.j: 延喜式神名帳では「高鴨阿治須岐託彦根命神社 四座」と記載され、名神大社に列し、月次・相嘗・新嘗の幣帛に預ると記されている。
sen.e: The shrine listed as "Takakamo Ajisukitqakahikone-no-Mikoto-jinja Shrine, four shrines", ranked as Myojin Taisha and Heihaku (a scramentl strip of silk offered to the deities) on monthly, Ainame and Niiname festivals in the Engishiki law.

In the Engishiki law the shrine is listed as "The Four Shrines of Takakamo Ajisukitakahikone-no-Mikoto-jinja Shrine", is ranked as a Myojin Taisha and heihaku (a strip of silk offered to the deities) are presented on monthly Ainame and Niiname festivals.
sen.cmt: Not a sentence. Spelling, word order, grammar. I'm not sure what the meaning of 'に預る' is.
sen.e: In the Engishiki law the shrine is listed as "The Four Shrines of Takakamo Ajisukitakahikone-no-Mikoto-jinja Shrine", is ranked as a Myojin Taisha and heihaku (a strip of silk offered to the deities) are presented on monthly, Ainame and Niiname festivals.
sen.cmt: 月次・相嘗・新嘗はそれぞれ別の祭であり、tran2においてmonthlyが相嘗と新嘗の両方を修飾するのは誤りと思われます。

sen.j: 東神社（天児屋命・天照大神・住吉三神）
sen.e: Higashi-jinja Shrine (Amenokoyane-no-Mikoto ・Amaterasu Omikami ・Sumiyoshi-no-Omikami)
Higashi-jinja Shrine (enshrining Amenokoyane-no-Mikoto, Amaterasu Omikami and Sumiyoshi-no-Omikami)
Higashi-jinja Shrine (enshrining Amenokoyane-no-Mikoto, Amaterasu Omikami and Sumiyoshi-no-Omikami)

sen.j: 西神社（主祭神 宗像三女神、配祀 天御勝姫命・塩冶彦命・瀧津彦命）
sen.e: Nishi-jinja Shrine (the main deity of Munakata-no-kami including Ikichishimahime-no-Kami, Tagitsuhime-no-Kami and Tagorihime-no-Kami, the associated deities of Amenomikatsuhime-no-Mikoto, Enyahiko-no-Mikoto and Takitsuhime-no-Mikoto)

Nishi-jinja Shrine (enshrining Munakata-no-kami as the main deity, but also including Ikichishimahime-no-Kami, Tagitsuhime-no-Kami and Tagorihime-no-Kami, the associated deities of Amenomikatsuhime-no-Mikoto, Enyahiko-no-Mikoto and Takitsuhime-no-Mikoto)

Nishi-jinja Shrine (enshrining Munakata-Sanjojin as the main deity, but also including Ikichishimahime-no-Mikoto, Tagitsuhime-no-Mikoto and Tagorihime-no-Mikoto, the associated deities of Amenomikatsuhime-no-Mikoto, Enyahiko-no-Mikoto and Takitsuhiko-no-Mikoto)
sen.cmt: 宗像三女神はMunakata-SanjojinとMypageに登録されており、三女神の各はKamiではなくmikotoです。瀧津彦命はTakitsuhiko-no-mikotoであり、himeではありませんので、修正しました。

sen.e: Hachiman-jinja Shrine ・ Hitokotonushi-no-Mikoto-jinja Shrine ・ Sarutahiko-jinja Shrine ・ Kotohira-jinja Shrine ・ Hijiri-jinja Shrine ・ Inari-jinja Shrine ・Matsuo-jinja Shrine ・ Hosoi-jinja Shrine ・ Oyama-jinja ・ Kasuga-jinja ・ Ikazuchi-jinja Shrine ・ Ichikishima-jinja Shrine ・ Yasaka-jjinja Shrine ・ Nishisami-jinja Shrine ・ Haraedo-jinja Shrine ・ Ushitaki-jinja Shrine ・ Samigokoku-jinja Shrine
